title: NFL Approves New Personal Conduct Code
teaser: The new policy approved by NFL owners takes chief disciplining responsibility out of the hands of NFL Commissioner Roger Goodwell.
contentencoded:
NFL owners unanimously approved a new and improved personal conduct code yesterday at their annual meeting in Irvine, Texas. The new policy takes chief disciplining responsibility out of the hands of NFL Commissioner Roger Goodwell.

The new code follows the controversy surrounding the suspensions of running backs Adrian Peterson and Ray Rice this season. Here & Now sports analyst Mike Pesca joins host Robin Young with details.

Guest

  • Mike Pesca, Here & Now sports analyst and host of Slate’s daily podcast The Gist. He tweets @pescami.
